etymology.description: Depicts the head and horns of an ox
etymology.interpretation: The character 牛(牛) (niú, "ox") is a pictogram representing the head and horns of an ox, reflecting its importance in agriculture and daily life in ancient China.

examples.chinese: 农民牵着牛(農民牽著牛)，去市场买东西(去市場買東西)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngmín qiānzhe niú，qù shìchǎng mǎi dōngxī。
examples.english: The farmer leads the ox and goes to the market to buy things.

examples.chinese: 农家养牛(農家養牛)，生活更加富足(生活更加富足)。
examples.english: Rural families raise oxen, making their lives more prosperous.

examples.chinese: 这个牛非常听话(這個牛非常聽話)。
